concept.title: Filling mechanism in pens
concept.shortdesc: The ink in pens can be replenished by three methods, depending on the type of the pen: lever, pneumatic, and eyedrop.

conbody.p: A pen has two parts: a nib and an ink reservoir. When the ink supply in the reservoir is over, the nib can no longer leave any marks on paper. That's when you need to refill the ink. How to refill depends on the type of the pen.

section.title: Lever
section.p: A small metal strip, fixed on the pen body, is used as a lever. When lifted, the point of the metal strip is pressed against the ink reservoir inside the pen body. This action creates a sucking force by which ink is drawn inside the reservoir through the nib.
